channel.title: WHATWG XMLHttpRequest Workstream-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by WHATWG XMLHttpRequest Workstream

item.title: [xhr] How about an example?
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ProgressEvent/ProgressEvent

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Constructor

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

How to call it with specifics.

What did you expect to see?

A constructor example will be very enlightening. Specially with the options...

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

item.title: [xhr] Define XMLHttpRequest "failure" on the responseText MDN page?
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/responseText

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/responseText#value

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

"or null if the request failed" is confusing to me because there is no definition of failed. Does this refer to a network failure? a 5XX error?

What did you expect to see?

An explanation that leaves me confident about when responseText will be a string and when it will be null.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

The linked section of the spec at https://xhr.spec.whatwg.org/#the-responsetext-attribute was interesting, and perhaps hints that null would not be associated with a 5XX error because it does not discuss response codes at all, but it was quite hard to read this part of the spec and reason about when responseText would be null due to the many layers of spec indirection required to even find a mention of null.

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/xmlhttprequest/responsetext
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/responseText
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/xmlhttprequest/responsetext/index.md
  • Last commit: 0a726c0
  • Document last modified: 2023-11-08T06:06:49.000Z

item.title: [xhr] xhr.abort is inaccurate
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/abort

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

No response

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

"The XMLHttpRequest.abort() method aborts the request if it has already been sent. When a request is aborted, its readyState is changed to XMLHttpRequest.UNSENT (0) and the request's status code is set to 0."

What did you expect to see?

Compare to the spec, it's clear that this doesn't cover the second case:

If this’s state is opened with this’s send() flag set, headers received, or loading, then run the request error steps for this and abort.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

item.title: [xhr] Issue with "FormData()": missing formdata event documentation
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/FormData

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

This page should mention and link to the formdata event.

The main FormData could also mention this event,.

Specific section or headline?

What did you expect to see?

Information about the FormDatas constructor running the event listeners for formdata and a link to this event's documentation.

Did you test this? If so, how?

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/formdata/formdata
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/FormData
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/formdata/formdata/index.html
  • Last commit: 5ecba2e
  • Document last modified: 2021-06-13T08:03:46.000Z
